title: rarestR: An R package for Rarefaction-Based Species Richness Estimator
text: rarestR R package rarefaction-based species richness estimator. package designed calculate rarefaction-based α\alpha- β\beta-diversity. also offers parametric extrapolation estimate total expected species single community total expected shared species two communities. package also provides visualization curve-fitting estimators.

title: rarestR: An R package for Rarefaction-Based Species Richness Estimator

what: Load rarestR and the demo dataset
title: rarestR: An R package for Rarefaction-Based Species Richness Estimator
text: dataset share matrix 3 rows 142 columns. comprises three samples randomly drawn three simulated communities. Every community consists 100 species approximately 100,000 individuals following log-normal distribution (mean = 6.5, SD = 1). Setting first community control group, second third community shared total 25 50 species control. detailed description control scenario groups can found Zou Axmacher (2021). share dataset represents random subsample 100, 150 200 individuals three three communities, containing 58, 57 74 species, respectively.

title: rarestR: An R package for Rarefaction-Based Species Richness Estimator
code: es(share, m = 100) ##        1        2        3  ## 58.00000 47.77653 53.00568 es(share, method = "b", m = 100) ##        1        2        3  ## 43.51041 40.74378 46.19118 # When the m is larger than the total sample size, "NA" will be filled: es(share, m = 150) ## Warning in es(y, m, method): m can not be larger than the total sample size ##        1        2        3  ##       NA 57.00000 65.24147

what: Compute dissimilarity estimates between two samples based on Expected Species Shared (ESS)-measures
title: rarestR: An R package for Rarefaction-Based Species Richness Estimator

what: Calculate and visualize the Total Expected Species base on ESa, ESb and their average value
title: rarestR: An R package for Rarefaction-Based Species Richness Estimator
code: Output_tes <- tes(share[1,]) Output_tes ##          est est.sd model.par ## TESa  138.50   2.46  logistic ## TESb   92.63  32.65   Weibull ## TESab 115.56  16.37      <NA> plot(Output_tes)

what: Calculate and visualize the Total number of Expected Shared Species between two samples
title: rarestR: An R package for Rarefaction-Based Species Richness Estimator
code: Output_tess <- tess(share[1:2,]) Output_tess ##     est est.sd model.par ## 1 23.28   2.59  logistic plot(Output_tess)

title: rarestR: An R package for Rarefaction-Based Species Richness Estimator
text: Zou, Y, & Axmacher, JC (2020). Chord-Normalized Expected Species Shared (CNESS)- distance represents superior measure species turnover patterns. , 11(2), 273-280. doi:10.1111/2041-210X.13333 Zou, Y, & Axmacher, JC (2021). Estimating number species shared incompletely sampled communities. Ecography, 44(7), 1098-1108. doi:10.1111/ecog.05625 Zou Y, Zhao P, Axmacher JC (2023). Estimating total species richness: Fitting rarefaction asymptotic approximation. Ecosphere, 14(1), e4363. doi:10.1002/ecs2.4363.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Peng Zhao. Author, maintainer. Yi Zou. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Zou Y, Zhao P, Axmacher JC (2023). “Estimating total species richness: Fitting rarefaction asymptotic approximation.” Ecosphere, 14(1), e4363. doi:10.1002/ecs2.4363. Zou Y, Axmacher JC (2020). “Chord-Normalized Expected Species Shared (CNESS)-distance represents superior measure species turnover patterns.” Methods Ecology Evolution, 11(2), 273–280. doi:10.1111/2041-210X.13333. Zou Y, Axmacher JC (2021). “Estimating number species shared incompletely sampled communities.” Ecography, 44(7), 1098–1108. doi:10.1111/ecog.05625.

title: Calculate the Expected Species — es
text: Calculate Expected Species

title: Calculate the Expected Species — es
Calculate the Expected Species — es
text: x data vector representing number individuals species m sample size parameter represents number individuals randomly drawn sample. ESa, m can larger sample size method calculation approach Expected Species used, two options available "" "b" calculate ESa ESb, default set "" MARGIN vector giving subscripts function applied , see 'apply'.

text: value Expected Species

title: Calculate the Expected Species — es
text: zou2023rarestR

title: Calculate the Expected Species — es
code: data(share, package = 'rarestR') rowSums(share) #The sum size of each sample is 100, 150 and 200 #>   1   2   3  #> 100 150 200  es(share, m = 100) #>        1        2        3  #> 58.00000 47.77653 53.00568  es(share, method = "b", m = 100) #>        1        2        3  #> 43.51041 40.74378 46.19118  # When the m is larger than the total sample size, "NA" will be filled: es(share, m = 150) #> Warning: m can not be larger than the total sample size #>        1        2        3  #>       NA 57.00000 65.24147

title: Compute dissimilarity estimates between two samples based on Expected Species Shared (ESS)-measures, using abundance data for the species contained in each samples — ess
Compute dissimilarity estimates between two samples based on Expected Species Shared (ESS)-measures, using abundance data for the species contained in each samples — ess
text: x community data matrix (sample x species); sample name row name matrix m sample size parameter represents number individuals randomly drawn sample, default set m=1, can changed according users' requirements. Rows total sample size <m excluded automatically analysis. index distance measure used calculation, one four options "CNESSa", "CNESS","NESS" "ESS", default set "CNESSa"

what: Calculation of Total Expected Species base on ESa, ESb and their average value — tes
title: Calculation of Total Expected Species base on ESa, ESb and their average value — tes
text: Calculation Total Expected Species base ESa, ESb average value

title: Calculation of Total Expected Species base on ESa, ESb and their average value — tes
Calculation of Total Expected Species base on ESa, ESb and their average value — tes
text: x data vector representing number individuals species knots specifies number separate sample sizes increasing value used calculation ES 1 endpoint, default set knots=40

title: Calculation of Total Expected Species base on ESa, ESb and their average value — tes
text: list self-defined class 'rarestr'. See "Details".

title: Calculation of Total Expected Species base on ESa, ESb and their average value — tes
text: value returned tes() function 'rarestr' class list containing three parts: par data frame summary estimated values standard deviations based TESa, TESb, TESab, model used estimation TES, either 'logistic' 'Weibull'. TESa list modeled results TESa method. TESb list modeled results TESb method. TESa TESb contain five parts, including data frame parameters ($par), data frame simulated results ($result), maximum x value ($xmax), vector predicted x value ($Predx), vector predicted y value ($Predy)

title: Calculation of Total Expected Species base on ESa, ESb and their average value — tes
text: zou2023rarestR

title: Calculation of Total Expected Species base on ESa, ESb and their average value — tes
code: data(share, package = 'rarestR') Output_tes <- tes(share[1,]) Output_tes #>          est est.sd model.par #> TESa  138.50   2.46  logistic #> TESb   92.63  32.65   Weibull #> TESab 115.56  16.37      <NA>

Predx vector predicted x value. Predy vector predicted y value.
